title: Job Vacancies at Carlcare Development
content:
Carlcare Development, formerly known as Tecno Telecoms - established in July 2006, is a high-tech company specializing in the R&D, production, sale and service of mobile communication products. After years of development, Carlcare Development has become an important part of the mobile phone industry and one of the major mobile phone manufacturers in the world. Currently, it has full ownership of three famous mobile phone brands TECNO, itel and Infinix, and an after-sales service brand Carlcare.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Data Entry Specialist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Entry Specialist to join our team in Ikeja. The successful candidate will be responsible for accurately entering, updating, and maintaining data across our systems while ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.


Responsibilities


	Enter and update data in spreadsheets and internal databases
	Clean, verify, and organize data for accuracy
	Use Excel functions (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, basic formulas) for data management
	Generate simple reports as needed
	Identify and correct data inconsistencies
	Support the team with other data-related tasks


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND/HND/Bachelor’s degree in any field with 1–3 years relevant experience
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel
	Fast and accurate typing skills
	High attention to detail
	Good communication and organizational skills
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Application Closing Date: 17th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: adebayo.deborah@transsion.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email

 

 

2.) Solar Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled Solar Energy Engineer to join our team in Lagos.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, installing, and maintaining solar power systems, ensuring optimal performance and compliance with industry standards.
	This role requires strong technical knowledge, hands-on experience, and the ability to troubleshoot system issues effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and develop solar photovoltaic (PV) systems for residential, commercial, or industrial use
	Conduct site assessments and prepare technical proposals
	Install, test, and commission solar power systems
	Perform routine inspections, maintenance, and troubleshooting of solar installations
	Ensure compliance with electrical standards and safety regulations
	Prepare technical reports, system documentation, and performance analysis
	Provide technical support and guidance to clients and internal teams
	Stay updated on new solar technologies and industry trends


Requirements


	Degree in Electrical Engineering, Renewable Energy, or related field
	2 - 5 years of hands-on experience with solar PV systems
	Strong understanding of solar system design, wiring, inverters, and electrical components
	Ability to read technical drawings and electrical schematics
	Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to safety
	Good communication and teamwork abilities


Application Closing Date: 24th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: adebayo.deborah@transsion.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Solar Technician

Job Location: Oyo

Job Summary


	The Solar Technician will be responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing solar power systems for residential, commercial, and industrial clients.
	The ideal candidate must have hands-on experience with solar installations and a strong understanding of electrical systems.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, test, and commission solar power systems, including panels, inverters, batteries, and mounting structures.
	Conduct routine maintenance on solar installations to ensure optimal performance.
	Troubleshoot system faults and carry out necessary repairs.
	Perform site assessments and determine system design requirements.
	Ensure all installations comply with safety standards and company procedures.
	Prepare service reports and maintain accurate documentation.
	Educate customers on system usage, basic troubleshooting, and safety guidelines.
	Collaborate with the engineering and sales teams to support project delivery.
	Monitor system performance and recommend upgrades or improvements.


Requirements & Qualifications


	OND / HND / B.Sc in Electrical Engineering, Renewable Energy, or related field.
	1 - 3 years of proven experience as a Solar Technician or in a similar role.
	Strong knowledge of solar PV systems, inverters, batteries (including lithium), and electrical wiring.
	Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
	Physical fitness and ability to work at heights.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	Must reside in Ibadan or be willing to relocate.


Application Closing Date: 12th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: adebayo.deborah@transsion.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
